Introduction
Overview over this manual
Chapter is concerned with the technical details of installing and running this package. The following chapter explains how to use &SCO; to compute simplicial (co-)homology of orbifolds. For the theoretical parts please refer to my diploma thesis and the corresponding paper (work in progress; ). After this chapter you will find some simple examples on using &SCO; with (finite) groups, manifolds, or some easy orbifolds. Also included in this manual is a documented list of the most important methods and functions you will need to work with &SCO;'s data types OrbifoldTriangulation and SimplicialSet and to create the matrices needed for computations. Anyone interested in source code should just check out the files in the gap/pkg/SCO/gap/ folder (&see; Appendix ).
